org.jay3d.engine.core.math

Class Quaternion

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jay3d.engine.core.math.Quaternion

  • public class Quaternion
extends java.lang.Object
    Quaternions are also commonly known as versors. They are convenient ways for representing orientations and rotations in 3D space.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quaternion

        public Quaternion(float x,
                  float y,
                  float z,
                  float w)

      • Quaternion

        public Quaternion(Vector3f axis,
                  float angle)
        Constructs and initialises the Quaternion with a specified axis and angle. Note, the direction you want to rotate is generally the opposite axis.

        Example: If you want to rotate your object horizontally, you must rotate it around the y-axis, this is because you're rotating AROUND the axis and not ON the axis. If you wish to rotate vertically, you must rotate around the x-axis.

        Parameters:
        axis - The desired axis to rotate around on.

        Example: Vector3f(1, 0, 0) rotates around the x-axis.

        angle - The desired to rotate on.

      • Quaternion

        public Quaternion(Matrix4f rot)
        This inisitialises and constructs a Quaternion is relation to a rotation matrix. This method comes from Ken Shoemake's "Quaternion Calculus and Fast Animation" article and thus is not written by me.
        Parameters:
        rot - The rotational Matrix used whilst constructing the Quaternion.

                                            float lerpFactor,
                                            boolean shortest)
        Parameters:
        dest -
        lerpFactor -
        shortest -
        Returns:

      • sphericalLinearInterpolation

        public Quaternion sphericalLinearInterpolation(Quaternion dest,
                                               float lerpFactor,
                                               boolean shortest)
        More commonly known as Slerp, spherical linear interpolation was introduced by Ken shoemake, in context of quaternion interpolation for animating 3D rotation. Thus, this refers to constant-speed motion along unit-radius great circle arc.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination quaternion.
        lerpFactor - The linear interpolation factor.
        shortest - Whether you want it to calculate shrotest possibly distance.
        Returns:
        Current Quaternion with Slerp added to it.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • dot

        public float dot(Quaternion q)
        Calculates the dot product of current quaternion by another quaternion.
        Parameters:
        q - Quaternion to multiple current quaternion by.
        Returns:
        New quaternion with multiplied values.

      • length

        public float length()
        Calculates the total length of current quaternion.
        Returns:
        The length of the quaternion.

      • normalise

        public Quaternion normalise()
        Divides each element, x, y, z, w by the total length of the quaternion. This also includes the length() function within the method therefore you shouldn't have to calcualte the length beforehand.
        Returns:
        New Quaternion with normalised values.

      • conjugate

        public Quaternion conjugate()
        Negates the x, y, z, w elements of the Quaternion.
        Returns:
        New Quaternion with conjugated values.

      • mul

        Returns:

                      float z,

        y - The value to set the y-element to.
        z - The value to set the z-element to.
